result.execSummary:
The defendant Sherman John Brown Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay any court costs and/or surcharges from CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT
Court STAYED sentence to January 2, 2016. Defendant is to report to the HOC's on 01-02-2016 by 5pm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sherman John Brown Jr

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Sherman John Brown in court with Attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve FIFTEEN (15) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for THREE (3) DAYS time served.  The Court STAYED the sentence to January 2, 2016.  The Defendant is to report to the House of Corrections on January 2, 2016 by 5:00pm.
 - The Court ordered Defendant to pay any court costs and/or surcharges.  The amounts are to come out of the $2,500 bail that is on deposit.  The balance, after fees taken out, can be mailed back to who posted it.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

FILED, Pretrial Incarceration Credit
FILED, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Sherman John Brown in court with Attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Jury Trial.  Counsels advised the Court that the matter is now a plea.  The State filed an Amended Information, received.    

As to plea:  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Matter is set for sentencing on December 16, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
State's Rebuttal Witness List, received and filed.
Defendant's Notice of Alibi, received and filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 10-27-2015 at 01:30 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 11-09-2015 at 8:30 a.m.
Court ordered STAYED bench warrant withdrawn.  Warrant was NOT forwarded to the Sheriff's Dept.

Defendant Sherman John Brown in court with Attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum, appearing for Lucy Kronforst, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.  Defendant now present in court.
Court will withdraw stayed bench warrant.
Discussion on the record with the parties.  Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 30.  Any alibi to be filed with the court NO LATER THAN 10-08-2015.
Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including monitoring by JusticePoint.

Calendar call scheduled for 09-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeffrey J Guerard in court.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum, appearing for Lucy Kronforst, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no explanation for defendant's non-appearance at today's scheduled plea hearing and informs Court he has been unable to contact defendant.
Branch 21 was contacted as to whether defendant may have checked into their court.

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 09-18-2015.   Court stays any forfeiture of bail until the next court date.

Defendant Sherman John Brown in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel does not appear.  Telephone call made to Attorney Guerard.  He did not realize this matter was calendared for this date. Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-20-2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Brash, Br. 21.

Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21 for scheduling conference.

Defendant Sherman John Brown in court with Attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Ronald Dague, appearing for Lucy Kronforst, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Peter Hauser.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.

Defendant Sherman John Brown in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Sherman John Brown in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
